header.title: The best fence installation company in Tracy
bullets: See why Ergeon customers in Tracy have been incredibly happy with their new fences!
We offer a variety of styles, all constructed by our talented team of local contractors.
Our competitive pricing and quality craftsmanship.
Our friendly team will be there every step of the way!

Yelp.description: Very helpful, understanding yet so professional. I like that they have attention to detail and know their job. They are very knowledgeable and use the latest technology. I like the way they break down cost to the minute details and have a good sense of direction!
Yelp.name: Ben T.
Yelp.title: Very helpful, understanding yet so professional.

Google.description: I received several quotes and one I found with Ergeon was best. With 3D picture, it was very easy to connect and see how everything is going to look like. When I compared quotes from all others, this was the one I was best, in terms of price, and detailed information was key to make my decision. The team came to work on project was very experienced and professional. The quality of work they did, I was very much impressed. Every thing they did was perfect and precise. I highly recommend them. Thank you Ergeon for providing excellent service!
Google.name: Daya P.
Google.title: Every thing they did was perfect and precise. I highly recommend them.

faq.front-yard: 3 feet solid , 4 feet (3 feet + 1 feet 50% open top)
faq.setback: no setbacks specific to fence ** except for reverse corner lots (see note and Diagram)
faq.corner-lot-rules: 3 feet Max Height on 25 feet visibility triangle area measured from property lines. No fence exceeding three (3') feet in height shall be placed on a reverse corner lot where such fence would be within ten (10') feet of the driveway of the adjacent lot unless the fence is located fifteen (15') feet from the street yard property line.

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor. Some people try to cut costs by using unlicensed contractors, but this can end up being a major issue if any problems happen during the installation or down the line. In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.

There’s a lot to consider when weighing the pros and cons of a wood fence versus a chain link fence. We’ve tried to make the process easier for you by diving deeper into some of the areas of consideration.
